intro: Cyanea multispicata, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers bloom throughout the year in the warm climate of Hawaii. Cyanea multispicata plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
